website_summaries.verdict: Easy to mold earplugs act like a waterproof seal. Good for kids, as well as adults.
pros: Earplugs float if you lose them
Works when using for all water sports
Created by an ear, nose, and throat physician
Different colors available for kids and fun in the pool
cons: May leave residue on ears and hair
Hard to use with bathing caps and may require short learning curve to use

customer_reviews.title: ... can get very stick and caught up in hair like gum). My daughter had another set of tubes ...
customer_reviews.text: Initially I thought these worked well (however agree with the comments that they can get very stick and caught up in hair like gum). My daughter had another set of tubes put in today and the doctor pulled out a wad of putty from these plugs from each of her ears. There was an alarming amount that had built up in her ears over the times she had used these, and some even had skin starting to grow over to where removing from her is causing her a bit of ongoing pain (however, I expect this to decrease quickly as the sore heals). Use with caution!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Not for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Leaves residue on ears and hair. It was impossible to remove from the hair and ears. I have attached photos for your reference.
customer_reviews.author: Mik

customer_reviews.title: I love these putty buddies!!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME EAR PLUGS!! My 3 year old had recurrent ear infections and also surgery for ear tubes. I had purchased what I thought were putty like ear plugs, but they would never stay in!! These are great. For my 3 year old I take 1 ear plug break it in half, roll into a cone shape and firmly press into ear. I cannot recommend these enough! I myself am a healthcare professional; these are the real deal. If you are searching for ear plugs for kids-these are the best!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, maybe too well?
customer_reviews.text: Love the size, the colors, the fact that it floats and you can find it, but no worries there--because it just won't come out of their ear. And I mean that literally! It is hard to 'unstick' to the point where you have to dig a little and it leaves a little residue. If it gets in hair, it's a mess, so put that hair in a pony tail first! I recommend it because I am a weekly/daily swimmer, and these last a long time....they still work even when they are months old and begin to smell (time for new ones).
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Swimmers ear infection through the air plugs two times 😞
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these earplugs. My daughter said that they were quite comfortable. We read the instructions thoroughly and I inserted them the proper way. We only used them for a couple of swims before we threw them away to make sure that they did not get overly worn. Sadly, water still got into her ears even though they looked thoroughly covered. She got two different ear infections that required medication because water still got into her ear and behind her ear drum.
customer_reviews.author: Sandee S

customer_reviews.title: Work well for our family
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my kids because we just purchased a house with a pool and they kept getting water in their ears and swimmers ear. These work well and form a perfect water tight seal, the only drawback is they cant hear well with them in (although I think 50% of it is just an excuse not to listen to me LOL). They have gotten their hair stuck in them though but easily comes out. Would buy again if needed
customer_reviews.author: D.T.

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a swimmer all my life, a swim coach, a swim instructor, and a lifeguard at various times. Never used ear plugs or a nose plug, often forego a swim cap. Just goggles and I was good to go. Not anymore. Over the last couple years I've developed some real problems with my ears and it made swimming impossible. Tried everything. Until I tried this: I paired these putty plugs with an Ear Band-It and, top it all off with a swim cap. AND NO WATER IN MY EARS. I CAN SWIM FOR REAL AGAIN. 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Myrabee

customer_reviews.title: These are a life-saver!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter had 'tubes' put in her ears and needed protection when swimming. These fit the bill and then some... the only struggle is that they have never 'floated' for us (as advertised). Otherwise, they are a 5-star product. Unsure what we may have done that caused them to sink (thankfully we discovered they don't float in a clean bath-tub), but still appreciate the excellent job these do of sealing!
customer_reviews.author: K.C.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps water out of ears and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been getting swimmers ear consistently along with ear infections. We tried these out and she loves them! They are easy to mold to the ear and stay in. Since using them, she hasn't had any water in the ear and can enjoy swimming without a worry! The one thing that we have trouble with is when they get caught in even a strand of hair, it is difficult to get out and sticks like gum. Other than that, they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay infantino

customer_reviews.title: Should Have Paid More Attention to the Package. ..
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was scared to use them. The Putty Buddies really are just little circles of putty that you have to form to the ear. For some reason, even with the picture AND the title, I assumed they had some type of shape to them. I'm afraid I wasted my money. Mainly based on the fear of the unknown. I should have done more research. These may be great but unfortunately the design of the product cause to many concern for the potential wearer.
customer_reviews.author: Ahsel Anne

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and reliability
customer_reviews.text: Love these plugs. I made the mistake of trying other brands and I’m back and not switching again! These mold so easily to son’s ear and he leaves them alone because they don’t move, don’t allow any water in while swimming, and most importantly they are comfortable. My son has tubes and these offer such comfort, knowing his tubes are being kept clear while swimming.
customer_reviews.author: bridgetb

customer_reviews.title: These ear plugs are great. My son (7 yrs old) had tubes put ...
customer_reviews.text: These ear plugs are great. My son (7 yrs old) had tubes put in his ears about a month ago. I purchased these as well as Mack's orange ear plugs. I like these better because they are easier to shape to fit his ears. I feel confident that it is keeping water out. They do not stain his ears like I've read in other reviews. Maybe that has to do with skin type, I'm not sure, but it isn't an issue for him. I can reuse them and I absolutely love that it came with a storage container. We will be using these when he swims this summer.
customer_reviews.author: MW2

customer_reviews.title: that got worse and turned into an infection that required antibiotics
customer_reviews.text: My son had swimmers ear, that got worse and turned into an infection that required antibiotics. He missed 4 days of swimming. We tried these ear plugs and the worked perfectly. We were worried that he may have to cut back on pool time. But these plugs are awesome and he finished the season, probably 7 or 8 hours in the pool, using these ear plugs with no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Box was EMPTY - NO EARPLUGS inside - beware
customer_reviews.text: If there was a zero I would have selected that option. The box was empty when it arrived!!! everything in the picture EXCEPT the actual ear plugs!!!!! I even threw all the packaging away before opening the box so I couldn’t even return it! Not to mention how excited my five year old son was that his earplugs had arrived only to not have anything in the package :( awful.
customer_reviews.author: BDough

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great product
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended by my son's ENT doctor, following his surgery. This is my second order. It holds well in any environment and my son has been using them for over a year. If placed correctly, there is absolutely no way water can get into his ears. The colors are great and its storage case is awesome. We just toss them into his bag for safe traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Cris D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for ruptured eardrum
customer_reviews.text: My eardrum ruptured during a really bad cold and I could not get my ear wet. These were just what I needed to be able to take a shower while my eardrum healed. They are easy to use, reusable, and definitely water proof! Also, Amazon was the only place where I could find these so don't bother driving out to the store to look for these while sick -- just pay for next-day shipping from Amazon (it's worth it!).
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Bourdon

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrate and coat hair with wax
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the floating Putty Buddy ear plugs on a whim, thinking it would be good for them to float if they fell out. I should’ve stuck with the originals. The floating ones disintegrate and coat the hair around my kids’ ears with wax. I have to scrape it out with my fingernails strand by single strand, and it’s horrible. We went back to the originals!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Samuels

customer_reviews.title: Works better than other ear plugs I've tried
customer_reviews.text: They come nicely formed but I wind up having to reshape them to block out water and noise completely. I do have to stick them in too far for best results and this hurts, but for me near plugs are needed. I am concerned about the dyes used. I put them under my pillow when I take them out and the color stains the pillow. Still, I recommend these over other ear plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Breeze1

customer_reviews.title: A must have for kids with ear pain
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for kids who get ear pain from swimming. My son used to wake up in the middle of the night screaming in pain every single time that we would go swimming. it was awful. These have been a lifesaver. As long as her puts them in correctly which is pretty easy for him to do (he is 10) he no longer experiences pain from swimming. They are reusable and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: ShanDoo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for ears that are difficult to fit
customer_reviews.text: I swim a few miles a week for exercise and am prone to ear infections, so I've tried a lot of earplugs. These are perfect. Just little blobs of plastic, really, but they really mold into my somewhat weirdly shaped ear canals and stay put through an hour of vigorous swimming. Supposedly they float if you drop them but they've never come out so I haven't tested that. The colors are fun, too. And the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Lheaven

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for small kids
customer_reviews.text: These ear plugs work well to keep the water out during swimming. If installed properly, they never fall out while playing in the swimming pool. They fit small children very well (3 and 4 year old). The included plastic case is very handy to keep them safe. One pair has lasted us over a year and still going strong. You don't need to wear a swim cap or head band to hold these earplugs in place. Our kid likes to jump into the pool (feet first) and also duck under water, but these have never ever fallen off in one year of regular weekly use in swimming pools.
customer_reviews.author: Sidd

customer_reviews.title: Great job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my five year old who is prone to ear infections. He loves his swim class but was missing class because of ear infection. Last winter I started using these ear plugs I have to say they were great! He was sick only once. And the best part is the plugs float. So if by chance he loses them, I can locate them easily. Will definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: maggie805

customer_reviews.title: Will not work for ear with surgery history.
customer_reviews.text: if you had ear surgery, this is NOT for you. DO NOT BUY at all cost. I bought 3-pair pack and could not even use a single one of them. Also, this is NOT REFUNDABLE. So buyer be aware.
customer_reviews.author: codyyyd

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, comfortable, and keeps the water out!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and actually works! My daughter has tubes in her ears so she needs ear plugs for swimming. The putty is great as it molds to hear ears and delivers a great deal to keep the water out. My daughter has no complaints with them. We will definitely be getting another set when we need them! Super great price for 3 pairs!!!
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless you have an ear bandit and a swim cap to keep them in place
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get these to stay in, which made swimming lessons a nightmare. They say you can use a half of one, but I had to use a whole one in each ear for our 18 month old...for it to stay somewhat. The ear bandit helps, if you can get your kid to not rip the ear bandit off their head. I gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Tews

customer_reviews.title: They work, but a bit hard to put in
customer_reviews.text: I hate having my ears under water, so these are definitely going to come in handy. It's a bit difficult putting them in because of the whole air tight suction against the ear thing, which makes me a bit nervous. The silicon doesn't seem quite tacky enough to keep a consistently perfect seal to keep 100% the water out of my ears. But it keep about 98% of the water out of my ears, so I call that satisfactory. Particularly considering the convenience of not needing to wear a swimming cap.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Sticks to hair like gum!!!
customer_reviews.text: Beware if you have long hair, it sticks to hair like gum! I had to cut off a significant chunk of hair from right above my ear because it got stuck in the putty during the night. If you sleep on your back this isn't an issue but if you are a side sleeper like me and your hair is shoulder length or longer beware. I didn't find it to be any more effective canceling out noise than the foam plugs I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Edina

customer_reviews.title: This s a terrible product and should be avoided at all costs
customer_reviews.text: This s a terrible product and should be avoided at all costs. These ear plugs are made of silicon and can easily fall apart in your ear when your try to put them in or take them out. I had silicon pieces that ended up in my ear canal and blocked my hearing. I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Grill Guy

customer_reviews.title: The fun possum character on the case is a bonus as ...
customer_reviews.text: Hooray! Ear plugs! Every kids dream is to get ear tubes and wear plugs, right? No? Well, if you find yourself in that situation you might notice as we did that our toddler actually enjoys wearing your plugs while swimming. Once we got over the “smash in your ear” part. The fun possum character on the case is a bonus as well as the fact that these will float if he happens to pull them out of his ears while swimming.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My son has tubes and my son LOVES the water. To avoid ear infection s, i needed something to keep the wayer out. The ear buddies are perfect. He is 4 years old and they fit just right. Easy to put in and easy to take out. Tney do sometimes leave a residue, but not enough to matter. These are a life saver. I use the ear band to help keep them in.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend for kids
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my 12 yr old daughter who has to use plugs while swimming, she was able to put ear plugs in and remove them herself, and they provided a good fit and kept the water out every time, love that they come with a plug holder to keep and reuse ear plugs, order was received on time and great price for the 3-pack,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine, but not as good as others.
customer_reviews.text: I use Aqua Ears a lot and thought I’d try something new to see if they compare.. they do not. These are much smaller, and they fall apart. They’re also more expensive. The only upside to these I found is the different colors to better keep track. If you’re looking for a silicone earplugs, this definitely wouldn’t be my preferred brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Piece broke off in ear
customer_reviews.text: We had to take our 10 year old to the doctor today as a piece of the silicone broke off as he was taking out his ear plug. It was deep inside and took the doctor some time to get it out. Just a warning that these can break apart.
customer_reviews.author: SDW

customer_reviews.title: Moldable is the best option.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love Putty Buddies moldable ear plugs. They are easy to mold and fit in ears of any size. I used these on my daughter and husband and both loved the fit and feel of them. I would recommend these to anyone who wants to protect their loved ones ears during this summer in the water or even in your bathtubs.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Helped prevent swimmer's ear.
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions closely and they are perfect. My 4 year old had swimmer's ear and we used these in combination with a head wrap until he healed. He used the same plug for roughly 7 or 8 uses and then we tossed them. His ears get waxy and they do not clean well. Otherwise they fit perfect and stayed in. We have some left over to use next year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Putty Buddies are effective, but inconvenient, messy; I recommend Mack's Pillow-soft Earplugs instead
customer_reviews.text: The Ear Band-it seems to be the best way to keep ear plugs in. We do have to continually tug at it to keep it covering the child's ears. I do not, however, recommend the Putty Buddies. As other reviewers have mentioned, they are super sticky/gummy, and really gum up my granddaughter's long, curly hair. Instead of the Putty Buddies, I highly recommend Mack's Pillow-soft Silicone Putty Earplugs, available at Walgreens for about $5. There are 12 earplugs in a plastic case (6 pair.). However, for my granddaughter, we tear one in half, and use half in each ear for a good solid seal.
customer_reviews.author: D. Webb

customer_reviews.title: They work too well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a summer vacation in Mexico. I tend to have problems with water in my ears when I swim, and took a chance on these because the reviews were great. Unfortunately, they work so well that I could not hear a thing that anyone was saying when I was wearing them, so I couldn’t use them.
customer_reviews.author: momof3dogsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: They are like putty. It says don't let it get in your ear canal or you might need a professional to remove it . They want you to just push it into the outer ear. that doesn't work. Then we were parinoid it would get into our ears. I just threw them away !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: The best of their kind
customer_reviews.text: They are the best. We've tried the orange ones and other brands like them, but these stay in our son's ears for hours. He got tubes put in in the spring of 2015, so it's been over a year we've used them. We've had them at the beach - ALL DAY AT THE BEACH, IN THE OCEAN! And we use them at the lake and in the tub as well. We just used them with our daughter as well who had swimmer's ear. I love the case and bright colors, so we can see them from a distance and know if one came out. We've never had a problem with them coming out.
customer_reviews.author: ys

customer_reviews.title: Overheated Silicone Sticky
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little uncomfortable with this product because after swimming--I swim with a cap--the Silicone is warm, and I have a hard time getting it unglued from my ears. Also, it sticks to my hair. (This from the wife) I wear the Silicone to keep the MUSIC out of my ears, not the water, but it works well for both. maybe I need to wait five minutes after removing the cap????
customer_reviews.author: Roscoe F. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Better than Mack plugs!
customer_reviews.text: Our ENT doctor told me about these plugs. I had always used Macks plugs for our child and then tried these. These are so much better. They aren't waxy and actually suction to his ear and stay put whereas the Mack plugs are more waxy and fall out easily. I will only buy these from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets stuck in longer hair
customer_reviews.text: For people with short hair, these likely work fine, but if you have hair that covers your ears, it can get stuck in the silicone. It is NOT FUN to pull hair out of silicone!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Not a Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. They didn’t keep water out until I forced the putty into the ear like an ear plug. If you can get them to work, you can use them once. They disintegrate once removed.
customer_reviews.author: Trooper1

customer_reviews.title: Handy dandy item
customer_reviews.text: Bought these before there were really available at Walmart these days. A must have if you or your family suffer from swimming ear problems after a day at the beach, lake or pool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! I do not use them for swimming
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I do not use them for swimming. I use them along with a foam ear plug to block my snoring husband. I have tried every product available. This is the best. Yes, they do become gooey and stick to my hair and ear after a few uses. Just dab the around the ear with the wax. Then use baby oil for the hair. I also use surgical tape to cover the ear. This prevents my hair from getting tangled in the wax. I am sleeping like a baby.
customer_reviews.author: MrsSack

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My son did great with these. They were easy to put in his ear, and he was still able to hear with them on. He didn't get any water in his ear when he was swimming. You can reuse them after and this product comes with a case for ear plugs that are in use.
customer_reviews.author: Mrzmendoza

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! They fit my 14 month-old's ears just fine! I don't need to make them any smaller. I plan on ordering more soon as we swim daily right now and just go from the pool to the bath. They last a few days for us, just because my little guy still has some ear drainage from his tubes, so we don't reuse them to many times. I love that they come with a small case so if we go somewhere that he's going to get wet I can just toss that in! AND I must say, I LOVE the bright colors! Makes them easy to find if you drop one lol :)
customer_reviews.author: Shopperific

customer_reviews.title: Part of the putty got stuck in my sons ear ...
customer_reviews.text: Part of the putty got stuck in my sons ear. Had to go to the drs office because we couldn't get it out!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie witmer

customer_reviews.title: "Water Problem"
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful for keeping water out of a sensitive ear, when showering. They are soft, pliable, and easily formed, and they create a reasonably good seal. I can't address how effective they would be while swimming, but I doubt if the seal is that complete. For my needs, it hasn't been an issue. Take great care removing them. You want to push up on the back of the ear to dislodge them, and slip them out intact. Leaving tiny bits of residue inside the ear will cause more problems than the Putty Buddies can solve. Be sure to discard them when they start to fray. It's cheaper to replace them than to have to rush to an ENT specialist.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Collin

customer_reviews.title: Falls out after the third time jumping in a pool .
customer_reviews.text: Hi... yes they float but they don’t stay in very long... they fall out of the ear if u jump in a pool a lot or get hit by a wave on the beach.. we got the swim head band to go along with the putty and our 4 year old didn’t get a ear ache!! Definitely will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John and Jessica

customer_reviews.title: For more sturdy (and smaller
customer_reviews.text: These may be ok for adults, but I agree with the reviews that say they crumbled or came apart in the ears. they are very sticky and almost too flexible. I use them in the shower because I need to keep my ears covered, but am careful not to push them in too far, because pieces do come off in my ear otherwise. For more sturdy (and smaller, for my female ears) plugs I use the orange Kid size Macks plugs, which I can also order from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: SMC

customer_reviews.title: Great seal for any size ear!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old Daughter got tubes this summer and I ordered 5 different types of earplugs. This was by far the best!! You don’t need to worry about size (wich was the problem with traditional earplugs). I am confident the water stayed out! We also bought a neoprene headband, which makes her feel secure. The putty base never fallen out. She can still hear well with them in. Very happy with this purchase and will be stocking up for next summer!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy S

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says it does...awesome
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My (almost 2yr-old) daughter had tubes put her ears and her ENT emphasized how diligent I would need to be in order to make sure water wouldn't get inside them. She told me about this product although she didn't tell me the exact name. Anyway, I bought them and they arrived the very next day. She sat without squirming or complaining as I placed them in. They were very easy to apply as well. So far, it keeps water out as the pliability creates a seal.I would give it 5 stars but I have yet to see how they hold up at a waterpark/swimming situation
customer_reviews.author: GinGin

customer_reviews.title: Very good return policy
customer_reviews.text: I didnt like to insert these in my ears- just not the right feeling for me, it flt weird and if i was going to lose them inside theear. However the company refunded my money and let me keep them so I gave them away. So i would say buy and try and if you dont like theres no risk in it.
customer_reviews.author: Daysi

customer_reviews.title: These are great! Go in very easily
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Go in very easily, stay put and come out when you gently pull on them. Keeps the water out of my son's ears in the pool and the tub. I do not recommend breaking them in half. Although they are very large, it works better when you cover the whole outside of the ear as opposed to just trying to do a smaller piece in the ear canal. This could also be dangerous if it slips too far in and you can't get it out in one piece. So leave the entire plug in tact even for the smaller kiddos like my 3 yr old.
customer_reviews.author: NoelleA0128

customer_reviews.title: Ear Band-it was a hit
customer_reviews.text: I had to wait until we were poolside to put these in to my 2 year old's ears so that she would be distracted enough to leave them alone, but they worked like a charm and she forgot about them within seconds. I was worried she wouldn't be able to hear me with these in, but that didn't seem to be a problem. I used these in conjunction with the ear band-it head band and we were the talk of the YMCA!
customer_reviews.author: raindae

customer_reviews.title: My 4 year old LOVES these!
customer_reviews.text: Omg, we LOVE these! Have tried other earplugs and they always just fall out. Not Puddy Buddies! They are so much easier to mold to his ears and he doesn't scream in pain like he did with the other kind when i put them in. They stay in place and can be used over and over. I only wish i'd gotten these sooner. They really are a game changer for my little fish who has tubes. I'd recommend these 100% and will keep purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only partially works to keep water out.
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up because I kept having issues with water getting into my ears while showering. I put these little putty buddies in and molded them to cover my ear holes. After taking them out there is still dampness inside my ears. They only partially work. Also, if you dry your hair with the things still in your ears the bright pink putty ends up on your towel. Little bits of putty tend to stay inside my ears too. I've stopped using them all together because they don't do a very good job and aren't worth the mess and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Puppy Luv

customer_reviews.title: They fall apart
customer_reviews.text: These will fall apart in the ears. They are like putting play dough into your ears. Keeps the water out, but also have to pick little pieces out of a kids ear. That’s not so fun. Will look for some silicone ones.
customer_reviews.author: Ronstyle

customer_reviews.title: Feels and smells like playdough
customer_reviews.text: Learned that my ears do not regulate pressure very well so I ordered a few brands to try for swimming. These were appealing because they are reusable but I was so disappointed. They felt like childrens playdough and did not come out in one piece any of the times I tried them. By the time you get all the playdough out of your ear, your hands smell like it. Highly recommend if you love playdough.
customer_reviews.author: Ashle

customer_reviews.title: The best ear plugs
customer_reviews.text: Love these ear plugs. My son has tubes and is a little fish, so we have tried a bunch of different brands. His swim school sells some that were good... better than the ones I bought from pharmacy and others I found on Amazon. I finally found these and realized the ones I was using from the swim school had nothing on these. These are soft and mold so well. They don't dry out fast like other brands. My son never cries that I am "hurting" him when I put them in. He loves the bright colors. For now on these will be the only ones I buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of cuteness

customer_reviews.title: Best earplugs for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Our ENT recommended these to keep water out of the ear in order to promote healing of a hole in the eardrum. We are very pleased and have tried other brands without the same success.
customer_reviews.author: anon329

customer_reviews.title: great for sleeping in silence
customer_reviews.text: I like wearing this when I need silence to sleep and its good. You could feel a bit weird at the first night but its comfortable and the best ear plugs for this purpose. I don’t know about other purposes, because thats how I use it 😃
customer_reviews.author: Thais M

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Ear plugs are good for a couple swims, but I can be very picky with the feel of ear plugs. I have purchased two 3-packs over the last 8 months and satisfied with the quality of the product. There was a minor issue with my last order; however, the company quickly responded to my email and helped me with my concern. The amazing customer service is most excellent and keeps me coming back for more.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Made a mess!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these ear plugs because I saw them on the Dr. Oz show being used to help quiet the noise in order to get a good nights rest. I used them for this purpose and put them in, as instructed, but upon awakening a big glob of the silicone was on my pillowcase that would not wash out. It also got all caught up in my hair and I had to spend time picking it out. Maybe used as a swimming ear plug it works great but I was not impressed using it at night.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are great! My 4 year old son started swimming classes ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great! My 4 year old son started swimming classes and didn't want to put his head in the water because it bothered his ears. We've used these a couple times already and they are perfect! He's gone all the way under water too with them. We split one piece into two pieces and it's worked fine so far. They are nice and soft. I purchased a different brand first but thought they felt hard to manipulate, these are super soft and spread nicely. Thanks! I can already see I'll be buying more of them!
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Keeps water out in the shower
customer_reviews.text: Though I have used this only a couple of times with my toddler, I must mention it is a fine product. At first, it took some time to get used to inserting it and making it stay on. It would pop right out. But there was a technique involved and it worked. I have only used it in the shower for my son and it seems to keep the water out. He can also hear us talk so that is a good thing. I would like to try this in a pool but hesitant for now. What if it falls in the pool? Will it stay on? I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: do_catmando

customer_reviews.title: I'm not at all as easy as just scrub try getting it in a toddler's ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not at all as easy as just scrub try getting it in a toddler's ear and have them sit still and not freak out when you're trying to put something in their ear it is a fun experience to say the least cotton balls with Vaseline on it seem to work better
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: a lifesaver for our family!
customer_reviews.text: My son has a problem with getting water in his ears and these do help to keep the water out. They float in the bath water and he doesn't mind them. If you/your child has tubes in their ears this will help to keep the water out. The plugs your able to rip into the size you need. Each for my one year old I'll get three plugs from roughly. I highly recommend over the rubbers you put in your ear. This just covers the outside of the ear :)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great ear plugs!
customer_reviews.text: My son had ear issues, one ear drum is mostly gone- and water getting in his ear is VERY uncomfortable. These are the first ear plugs that have kept the water out enough to even wash his hair! I will definitely be keeping a stock of these on hand until he has surgery next year!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Ellis

customer_reviews.title: The most moldable earplugs I have found!
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs are the softest, easiest to mold ear plugs that I have found yet. My almost 5 year old son refuses to wear ear plugs at all, however needs one in his right ear. While I couldn't convince him to keep it in, this is the first time I was able to actually mold one to his outer ear. I definitely call this progress and am optimistic that we'll be able to work up to getting him in the pool with one of these in. He loves the colors, too, which helps when trying to convince him to use it at all. Great product and they shipped and arrived very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca C.

customer_reviews.title: Really Helps!
customer_reviews.text: Great especially if your kid has tubes or is prone to ear infections and needs to keep their ears dry. Also, I use a swimmer’s headband on top of my son’s ears in addition to the puddy buddies.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey O.

customer_reviews.title: BE CAREFUL, READ THE DIRECTIONS!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to push one of these in my ear hole and pushed in airtight air causing some pain to the ear drum that lasted for weeks
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: They stay in!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried everything under the sun for my 1 year-old that has ear tubes. Most everything falls out or she can get them out herself. Well, these stay in! Yes, they can be difficult to get out of a squirming child, but I would rather them be hard to remove so she doesn't take them out. They stayed in the entire day out at the lake. You do need to be caredful removing them so you don't leave anything in their ears, but it really isn't difficult. This is a must buy for children with tubes if you are planning on summers out at the lake or beach.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett Smith

customer_reviews.title: Prevent ear infections!!!
customer_reviews.text: These help prevent swimmers ear and ear infections!!!! They help keep the water out!!! I have super small ears and I can make the plus the size I need!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara M Roberts

customer_reviews.title: I bought them for my infant to take baths and i can easily tear them into smaller pieces to fit in his ...
customer_reviews.text: These ear plugs work as they're supposed to. I bought them for my infant to take baths and i can easily tear them into smaller pieces to fit in his ears. They are soft silicone so you may mold them into whatever shape they need to be. I tried them myself and they're very comfortable compared to foam ear plugs. There is a small container with a lid to help keep them clean, as the ear plugs are reusable many times.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler A. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Seal!
customer_reviews.text: I love Putty Buddies especially now since they float and I don't have to dive to the bottom of the pool to retrieve a plug in the unlikely event of a dislodge! I did experiment with a few other products, including one from a VERY renowned company but realised that these work best with my swim cap! Do follow the insertion and removal process and you will not go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: rk

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in hair
customer_reviews.text: Hated them - it’s like using play dough for ear plugs - they fell apart and got all stuck in my daughters hair...wld probably work better if used with head wrap
customer_reviews.author: tami morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great concept
customer_reviews.text: This product and the headbands rock. Because of surgeries, I cannot get any water in my ear and have found the combination is not always 100% waterproof. However, they sure go a long way to giving someone with ear concerns a great alternative for swimming, etc. to provide a good level of protection.
customer_reviews.author: Reengineering geek

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, functional, affordable
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised how well these work. I swim about 40 laps 2 to 3 times a week. They fit in my ears perfectly and I don't even notice them. They seal ears completely and float well (though I've never had to worry about that because they've never fallen out yet). Very comfortable, and affordable. Can be adjusted to fit any ear size
customer_reviews.author: Andreanna

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I put these in and they worked. I was surprised they didn't fall out as I was swimming. Overall, good product! I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: FELIX TORRES

customer_reviews.title: Putty Buddies are great!
customer_reviews.text: These Putty Buddies are a great product! I bought these for my two year old grandson to wear when his daddy plays the drums and when he plays his little set. He has such tiny openings to his ears so these were perfect. We used only a quarter of one the Putty buddies and it was a perfect fit. My grandson hates his ears being messed with but he miraculously let these stay in :-) I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Klfreeman

customer_reviews.title: Did not disappoint...
customer_reviews.text: They did what they were supposed to do and even recommended to a couple of friends who went ahead and purchased them and also were truly satisfied with the product. Will order some new ones when next season arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kiddos with tubes!
customer_reviews.text: We get these delivered monthly, as our son has tubes and prone to ear infections with tubes. We use these everyday for baths, as well as swimming and beach trips. He never complains, no issues with putting them in or removal. Careful, they can get stuck to your hair.
customer_reviews.author: J. Whitlock

customer_reviews.title: My son has a perforated ear drum, and these ...
customer_reviews.text: My son has a perforated ear drum, and these ear plugs work perfectly to prevent any water from getting in his ear. He uses them in pools, lakes, the ocean, water slides, you name it. The only down side to these is that over time they get full of oils from your skin due to handling. But I think that's to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Formerly Gluten-free dad

customer_reviews.title: No more ear infections!
customer_reviews.text: This keep my son's ear infections in check. They completely block out water from his ear when no other product works. They can get a bit sticky and you'll have to clean out the ears periodically. My son wears them every time he bathes, meaning everyday. That may not be the case for you. Extremely happy and a subscriber.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ang

customer_reviews.title: It broke off in my ear. Bad product. Not safe.
customer_reviews.text: Water still got in my ear somehow and the putty got wet and broke off in my ear. It took 2 men, multiple flashlights and sets of tweezers to remove it from my ear canal. Never had this happen before with silicone earplugs. I want a refund and I’ll never buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my two-year-old son who has tubes in his ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my two-year-old son who has tubes in his ears. He wears these with a headband, and it keeps the water out of his ears, even when swimming under water.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: ... these for the first time yesterday and they worked great! I had purchased a few different types of ...
customer_reviews.text: Used these for the first time yesterday and they worked great! I had purchased a few different types of ear plugs from the drug store and they didn't work at all. My one year old daughter wore them for about 3 hours. They were easy to put on and didn't fall out. She has tubes in her ears so she needs ear plugs when we go to the pond.
customer_reviews.author: db rd

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 kids had tubes in their ears for 2 years and used these in the water. They work great, they can put them in and take them out themselves and can still hear with them in.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn Firestine

customer_reviews.title: Stops shower water in ears
customer_reviews.text: Use for bathing or showers to keep all water out of inner ear .works great if you follow the instructions well...had too many ear infections.... this has greatly reduced that.
customer_reviews.author: jane swanson

customer_reviews.title: These were life savers (or ear savers to be precise!)
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best ear plugs we've ever used. We have tried so many and these are the only ones that seem to fit my son's ears. He's used these from ages 6-8. He loves the different colors and we love that he doesn't get swimmer's ear with these. The other brands would always seem to fall out while he swam, most of the time unbeknown to him, then invariably he would get a painful ear infection.
customer_reviews.author: Kogie

customer_reviews.title: Putty Buddies
customer_reviews.text: These worked very well for my 10 yr old who had swimmers ear. The mold easily into the ear and stayed in place during his entire time in the pool. They also float if they happen to pop out. We chose these because of the color so they were less noticeable. They come with a convenient box to keep them in your swim bag. We broke 1 in half for each ear, so there is plenty to use for the rest of the summer.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Great, very comfortable and soft
customer_reviews.text: Great, very comfortable and soft. Just make sure you move your hair out of the way. I put them in when I was half asleep and my roommate woke me out of dead sleep with her snoring. It's better to put them in when you are awake and can move your hair back out of the way. Nevertheless, I was able to go back to sleep, and sleep like a baby. They were so comfortable, I didn't notice I had them in in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Pbsceo

customer_reviews.title: Fits any type of ear
customer_reviews.text: Still allows water in but works very well to fit into my ears. Even regular youth plugs are too big for me so the putty is great!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Davis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: These are really high quality ear plugs. They're very pliable and stayed in my 4 year old ears very well during her swim class. They felt secure enough for her to let go of her anxiety of putting her head underwater (for fear of pain from ear tubes). We've used other plugs before but they wouldn't have the best fit and fall out- she's never felt comfortable enough to submerge her head. We didn't have to test their buoyancy but I love that they float- very important for the pool. Very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: NMG0141

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Used these with the Ear BandIt Ultra swimmer's headband and they worked great together to keep water out of my son's infected ear. The putty doesn't go inside the ear canal so it won't hurt a red, inflamed ear. These would also be great for keeping water out of ears that are prone to infection.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: They worked perfectly and seemed comfortable for him
customer_reviews.text: We went to the lake for vacation and my son needed these as he had tubes put in his ears 6 months ago. They worked perfectly and seemed comfortable for him. A little tough to pull out if they mess with them too much and push them in too far. But all in all worked great and I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works well, once you get the hang of it!
customer_reviews.text: The Putty Buddies require a bit of fiddling to get them to fit properly, but they do the job. There's a small learning curve to fit them properly; your ear must be completely dry in order for the putty to successfully adhere, and you have to resist the urge to push them into your ear a bit -- a definite NO-NO! I use them to keep a perforated eardrum dry, and so far, they work.
customer_reviews.author: S Mac

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old son has a hole in his ear drum and cannot get his ears wet. He loves to swim. These have been a life saver for him. Easy to put in and cover the entire area by molding them to his ears. He uses them to shower every day. I don't have to worry about him jumping in the pool or going under water because I know these will protect his ears.
customer_reviews.author: Paris Rose

product_meta.title: PUTTY BUDDIES Floating Earplugs 3-Pair Pack – Soft Silicone Ear Plugs for Swimming & Bathing – Invented by Physician – Keep Water Out – Premium Swimming Earplugs – Doctor Recommended
feature_bullets: SOFT SILICONE EARPLUGS. Easy to use and mold to the ear! MUCH MORE soft & comfortable than other ear plugs. WORLD’S ONLY FLOATING SOFT MOLDABLE SILICONE EARPLUGS. Float on water if dropped or dislodged.

RECOMMENDED BY DOCTORS WORLDWIDE. Invented by an Ear, Nose, Throat Physician. HELPS PREVENT SWIMMER’S EAR. Perfect for ear tubes, perforated eardrums, myringotomy, myringotomy tubes, otitis media, and otitis externa.
GUARANTEED EAR PROTECTION. Block water from the ear canal! Great for swimming, bathing, surfing, water skiing, canoeing, and kayaking. Perfect for traveling to the pool, lake or beach.
TACKY TEXTURE keeps earplugs in place. ONE-SIZE-FITS-ALL design. Great for kids and adults! Reusable and last longer than other earplugs.
Bright colors are appealing to kids. Kids love them! THE BEST SWIMMING EARPLUGS & EAR PROTECTION. Use with the EAR BAND-IT or EAR BAND-IT ULTRA SWIMMING HEADBAND for best protection.
